channel.title: Liniux VPS isnt loading my NPCS?
channel.description: i set up a linux vps like a few hrs ago and noticed that my npcs where gone and i cant find the fix can some 1 please help??!?! add me msn imanzereo@hotmail.com

item.source: Liniux VPS isnt loading my NPCS?

item.title: Liniux VPS isnt loading my NPCS?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

You have to include the files to compile when you run javac.

javac path/to/*.java path/to/another/*.java

When using javac, you must include the package names. It’s usually just easier to use the wildcard ‘*’ character, or use a build tool like ant.

Read full topic

item.description:

im an 0:

i alredy have jdk 6 installed i dont know much abot vpses… i need to put somthn in the compile.bat file i dont know what and i dont know the command to compile it

The command to compile is javac.

Linux systems don’t understand batch files.

item.source: Liniux VPS isnt loading my NPCS?

item.title: Liniux VPS isnt loading my NPCS?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

im an 0:

no for the vps can you just teamview me? please ima visual learner =P

No. You’re not a “visual learner”. You just want me to do it for you, then when I’m finished you say "OH! I see, thanks for the help! "

All you have to do is download the jdk package from the repository for your distribution. For Ubuntu, you open Terminal, then type in

sudo apt-get install openjdk6-jdk

item.title: Liniux VPS isnt loading my NPCS?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

im an 0:

… nothing wouldve made them not spawn though i uploaded the source the npcs didnt spawn i checked my local one that i havent changed and their there

You must have changed something, because the host operating system has no impact on whether or not the Npcs spawn.

Did you compile? Perhaps you changed something without realizing it.

Read full topic
